Demonstration before U.S. embassy in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The co-representative of the solidarity for implementing the south-north joint declaration and the permanent chairman of the headquarters of the people's movement for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops under the joint conference for opposing the U.S., war and nuke reportedly held a demonstration one by one in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on November 1, urging the U.S. to drop its hostile policy toward the DPRK, implement the Geneva agreement and conclude a peace agreement.
 They said that the U.S. is increasing war atmosphere, talking about the nuclear issue of North Korea in a bid to break off all articles of the Geneva agreement.    
 Saying that they can no longer sit idle to see the U.S. threatening world peace, not minding a war for its interests, they called on the 70 million Koreans to put an end to the U.S. moves for a war without fail and reunify the country by themselves.
